meanings.definition: The external form or appearance of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The artist used different shapes to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent2: The shapes of the clouds in the sky changed throughout the day.
meanings.sent3: The toddler giggled as he tried to stack the colorful shapes together.
meanings.sent4: Her smile took on the shape of a crescent moon in the dim light.
meanings.sent5: The shapes of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to put them together.

meanings.definition: A particular form or appearance of something.
meanings.sent1: The cake had a unique shape that caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The shapes of the leaves in the garden varied from round to pointy.
meanings.sent3: The detective carefully examined the shape of the footprint left at the scene.
meanings.sent4: His argument took the shape of a persuasive speech that swayed the audience.
meanings.sent5: The shape of the mountain resembled a sleeping giant in the distance.

meanings.definition: To give a particular form or shape to something.
meanings.sent1: She shapes the clay into different figures with her skilled hands.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor shapes the marble block into a stunning statue.
meanings.sent3: The chef carefully shapes the dough into perfect circles for the cookies.
meanings.sent4: His experiences in life have shaped his beliefs and values.
meanings.sent5: The teacher shapes young minds by inspiring them to learn and grow.
